items.title: cLean
items.description: Intended to support the development of cLean, a Lean DSL aimed at writing AIR circuits directly in Lean (rather than verifying pre-existing circuits extracted to Lean).

items.title: LLZK
items.description: Intended to support for the development LLZK, a MLIR dialect for circuits.

items.title: Lean backend for Sail
items.description: Intended to support the development of a Lean backend for Sail (adding to the existing HOL4, Isabelle, and Rocq backends) that will allow the extraction of the official RISC-V Sail specification to Lean.
items.awardedTo: University of Cambridge, Galois, Lindy Labs

items.title: Formalization of lookup arguments and extraction of Jolt statements to Lean
items.description: Intended to support an effort to develop a Lean DSL for lookups, their composition, and R1CS constraints that will allow Jolt-like circuits be verified.

items.title: Certified compilation with precompiles
items.description: Intended to support research aiming to establish methods for certified compilation in the Rocq ecosystem together with tools for high assurance cryptography in order to develop formally verified artefacts relevant to this project.

items.title: Development of an EVM in Rocq
items.description: Intended to support the development of a canonical, maintainable, and validated EVM specification in Rocq that can be the basis for a verified implementation of the EVM specification for RISC-V via certified compilation.

items.title: Verification of revm and Lean backend for K
items.description: Intended to support (i) effort to verify the correctness of revm compiled to RISC-V against KEVM (a EVM specification in K); (ii) the development of a Lean backend for K that will make it possible to compare KEVM to a Lean specification of the EVM, and open up possibilities to use the K tooling for language semantics in Lean in future work.

items.title: ArkLib
items.description: Intended to support the development of ArkLib (fka ZKLib), a library of formalized proof systems in Lean, accompanied by work on VCVio.

items.title: ZKProofs 7
items.description: Intended to support to ZKProofs 7 in March 2025.

items.title: ZKProofs Zurich Event
items.description: Intended to support to host a small one day event in Zurich in October 2024 to discuss the formal verification of proof systems. A summary of the event is available here.
